name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: [SOUND] This lecture is about

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: the Feedback in Text Retrieval.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _So
column6: in this lecture

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: we're going to continue the discussion on text retrieval methods.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _In particular
column6: we're going to talk about Feedback in Text Retrieval. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: This is a diagram that shows the retrieval process.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: We can see the user would typed in a query and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: then the query would be sent to a Retrieval Engine or

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: search engine and the engine would return results.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: These results would be shown to the user.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _After the user has seen these results
column6: the user can actually make judgments. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _So for example
column6: the user has say

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: this document is not very useful.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _This is good again
column6: et cetera. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _Now this is called a relevance judgment or Relevance Feedback
column6: because we've _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: got some feedback information from the user based on the judgments.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: This can be very useful to the system.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: Learn what exactly is interesting to the user.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: So the feedback module would then take this as input and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: also use the document collection to try to improve ranking.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _Typically
column6: it would involve updating the query. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: So the system can now rank the results more accurately for the user.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: So this is called Relevance Feedback.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: The feedback is based on relevance judgements made by the users.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _Now these judgements are reliable
column6: but _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _the users generally don't want to make extra effort
column6: unless they have to. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: So the downside's that involves some extra effort by the user.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _There is another form of feedback called a Pseudo Relevance Feedback

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: or a blind feedback also called an automatic feedback.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _In this case
column6: you can see once the user has got without an effect

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: we don't have to involve users.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: So you can see there's no user involved here.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: And we simply assume that the top ranked documents to be relevant.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _Let's say
column6: we have assumed the top ten is relevant. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: And then we will then use these assumed

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: documents to learn and to improve the query.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _Now you might wonder
column6: you know

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: how could this help if we simply assume the top rank documents would be random.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: Well you can imagine these top rank documents are actually similar to relevant

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _documents
column6: even if they are not relevant

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _So
column6: it's possible to learn some related terms to the query from this set. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _In fact
column6: you may recall that we talked about using language model to _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: analyze word association to learn related words to the word computer.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: Right?

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _And then what we did is first

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: use computer to retrieve all the documents that contain computer.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _So
column6: imagine now the query here is a computer. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: Right?

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: And then the results will be those documents that contain computer.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: And what we can do then is to take the top end results.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: They can match computer very well and we're going to count

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: the terms in this set and then we're going to then use the background

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _language model to choose the terms that are frequent the in this set

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: but not frequent the in the whole collection.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _So
column6: if we make a contrast between these two
column7: what we can find is that _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _we'll learn some related terms too
column6: the work computer as what I've seen before. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: And these related words can then be added to the original query to expand the query.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _And this would help us free documents that don't necessarily match computer

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: but match other words like program and software.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: So this is factored for improving the search doubt.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _But of course
column6: pseudo relevancy feedback is completely unreliable. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: We have to arbitrarily set a cutoff.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: So there is also something in between called Implicit Feedback.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _In this case
column6: what we do

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: we don't have to ask users to make judgements.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _Instead
column6: we are going to observe how the user interacts with the search results. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _So
column6: in this case
column7: we're going to look at the clickthroughs. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _So the user clicked on this one and the
column6: the user viewed this one. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: And the user skipped this one and the user viewed this one again.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: Now this also is a clue about whether a document is useful to the user and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: we can even assume that we're going to use only the snippet here in this document.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _The text that's actually seen by the user

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: instead of the actual document of this entry in the link.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _There that same web search may be broken
column6: but that

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _If the user tries to fetch this document that because of the displayed text

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _we can assume this displayed text is probably relevant is interesting to user

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: so we can learn from such information.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _And this is called Implicit Feedback and we can again

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: use the information to update the query.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: This is a very important technique used in modern search engines.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _You know
column6: think about Google and Bing and they can collect a lot of user activities. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: Why they are serverless?

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: Right. So they would observe what documents we

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _click on
column6: what documents we skip. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: And this information is very valuable and

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: they can use this to encode the search engine.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _So to summarize

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: we would talk about the three kinds of feedback here rather than feedback.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _Where the use exquisite judgement
column6: it takes some used effort

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: the judgement that information is reliable.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _We talked about the Pseudo Feedback
column6: where we simply assumed top random documents. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _We get random
column6: we don't have to involve the user. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _Therefore
column6: we could do that actually before we

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: we return the results to the user.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _And the third is Implicit Feedback
column6: where we use clickthroughs. _

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: _Where we don't
column6: we involve users

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: the user doesn't have to make explicit effort to make judgement.

name: 4 - 8 - 3.6 Feedback in Text Retrieval (00-06-49).srt
text: [MUSIC]
